sect2.title: System.LastIndexOf
sect2.para: LastIndexOf returns an Integer value idendifying starting position in AString of the LAST occurance of ASubString. If ASubString is not found in AString, -1 is returned. If ASubString is empty, -1 is always returned (the empty string is not found in any string).

LastIndexOf is similar to the LastPos operator. The difference is in the order of the parameters. Because D4 allows OOP-stlye operator invocation on every operator. The parser invokes the operator as if the calling variable is the first argument of the operator. Though the LastPos operator makes more sense when calling out of OOP-style, this operator makes more sense when called OOP-style.
Dataphor indexes are zero based.
LastIndexOf does a case-sensitive comparison.
